abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as
            satisfactory, while sustainability is assessed as ilikely.
            Both World Bank and Borrower performances were satisfactory
            overall. The following are some of the lessons learned: 1)
            With more than half of China's absolute poor living
            outside the 592 nationally designated counties, targeting
            social services delivery projects at the poor township level
            would more effectively include larger percentages of the
            absolute poor. However, the counties should be given chief
            administrative responsibility for such projects since
            townships lack the administrative capacity to manage such
            poverty targeted projects. 2) Policy changes and
            institutionalization of programs, such as student assistance
            programs, can be realized when the appropriate survey work
            is conducted and pilot programs are developed and tested,
            based on survey work. 3) Limited use of library books and
            teaching equipment is a problem; librarians and teachers
            must be released from personal responsibility for the books
            and equipment if full use of these materials is to be
            realized. 4) Project management training can contribute to
            institutionalizing a system of management when such training
            is conducted over the life of a project. 5) The key issue in
            developing education projects at the provincial, county, and
            township level is to convince the Chinese preparation teams
            that focusing on development outcomes is more important than
            emphasizing investment inputs.
